Reviews.Title: “Questionable Outside, Surprising Inside”
Reviews.Author: Clubess1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Del Mar looks almost seedy from the outside. In a city with beautifully-kept plazas, this square, Pla del Palau, has people who hang around for no discernible reason, the storefronts next to the hotel have graffiti on them, and the stepdown area directly in front of the hotel could use a cleaning. On the other hand, once you walk in the hotel, the interior more than makes up for its outer appearance. It feels clean and modern inside. The hotel has a bit of a nautical theme seeing as it is somewhat close to the water, with maritime objects in window cases, white marble staircase leading to upper floors, nautical charts on the walls, and an indoor terraza/sitting area with inner windows overlooking it. There is a TV/computer room on the first (not lobby) floor that is a good place to hang out if you don't want to be in your room. There are small balconies outside of many of the rooms that offer somewhat of a view. The hotel is well located: a ten minute walk to the marina, a bit further to La Rambla, the Barri Gotic, Olympic village towers (not the area where the actual Olympics were held, that is further away, on Montjuic). A naval college is across the street. Several buses stop in front of the hotel, and the Metro (Barceloneta station) is half a block away. We were not impressed with the day staff at the front desk; they were somewhat short with us, although the younger man who wears the short, blue jacket was very helpful. On the other hand, the gentleman who works at the desk overnight was VERY helpful, friendly and, in fact, rode and chatted with us on the Metro to Urquinaona on our last morning there, then got off the train with us and pointed the way towards our destination at Catalunya. We are sorry that we did not get his name as he was very personal and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: mariandtheboys
Reviews.Content: The location was great. The subway stop was a 2 minute walk . The Rambla was a pleasent 10 minute stroll along the Barcelona port. The old city and catthedral were also in a very short distance. The rooms clean and nicely decorated. The price was very affordable. You'll need those extra euros to pay the entrance fees to all the amazing (and expensive) things to see in Barcelona. The tv worked poorly and there was no wifi. but honestly, I didn't miss them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great price”
Reviews.Author: VizziOne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a marginal area, close to everything, You have to watch out as with any hotel. There are great inexpensive restaurants and bars in this area. The hotel is clean and plenty of hot water, breakfast was pretty good I would stay here again due to price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Place”
Reviews.Author: Enrico N
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a very good position in the city, very close to the sea and the Ramblas. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, the breakfast is international and of good quality. The staff is very kind:we had a problem with the electrical key, and they solved it fast. Our room was really quiet, so the place where is the hotel. Reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: VallyC
Reviews.Content: Finally a 3 stars hotel which services corrisponds to a 3 stars. Staff very courteous and polite. The location was great. You can reach by feet the Cathedral, Las Ramblas, it's close to a large shopping center . In front of the hotel there is the bus stop across the street- the Metro . The breakfast was good. The room was small, our was equipped with a small terrace with beautiful view to the port, but no bidet. The idea is that you get what you pay for - no more and no less. However, we were satisfied. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cazandash
Reviews.Content: Really couldn't fault this hotel. We had a room on the 4th floor with a roof terrace with great views. The rooms were spotlessly clean, bed comfortable and the bathroom had a bath, shower and hairdrier (always a bonus). The breakfast was good, not great, but perfectly adequate. The staff were friendly and helpful and booked tickets over the phone for the tablao de carmen flamenco show and ordered our airport taxis for us. The location is fantastic. Just a few minutes walk in one direction to the seafront and the restaurants of Barceloneta or a lovely 10 minute walk to the bottom of Las Ramblas. The public transport was very good and stopped close to the hotel. I would definately recommend the tourist bus which you can hop on and hop off at all the different attractions. It certainly made seeing all the sights much easier. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: TupeloIreland
Reviews.Content: Location near Port Vell & 5 minutes stroll to La Rambla = great; shower = really strong. Unfortunately these are the only 2 positives I have about this hotel. Had to move from 1st room we were given as it faced onto street and has curious stains on the wall - looked like blood :-( Ended up in a quiet room, but discovered semen stains on the blanket on my bed - obviously cleaning service isn't great. Rather than move again, I left it for the cleaners. Most of the reception staff were friendly but some were apathetic & unfriendly. Barcelona is a beautiful place and hope to go back again - not to this hotel though. As my friend said to me: you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: forbenjoy
Reviews.Content: the location really can't be beat in my opinion, since it is very near a metro stop and yet not in a congested area. we were able to walk just about everywhere we wanted to visit and for those more remote tourist sites, we took the metro. it is also a short taxi ride to the port, which made it easy to embark on our cruise. the room was clean and had a nice little balcony. there is a 2 euro fee per day for the in-room safe, which we used. the front desk staff were somewhat helpful, depending upon which person was on duty. i'd suggest booking with rumbo, a spanish booking website for the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: asiljr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel at the very end of November and found it quite comfortable. We asked for a quiet room and was given one facing the back lane, which indeed is very quiet. However, this means lack of airflow and as there were some problems with air conditioning I'm not sure how comfortable - or rather uncomfortable - the room might become in summer. The breakfast is part of the hotel's deal, and it is reasonable, with good choice of food. We also found the reception staff helpful and polite. As far as the location is concerned, it can't be better. The hotel is located right between Port Vell and the Gothic Quarter. It is also very well served by buses, though the nearest metro station is about 15 minutes away. On the negative side I should mention the lack of Internet access in the room. I thought it's a pretty standard feature nowadays for most of the hotels located in tourist cities. Apparently, there's a public computer but they charge 5.00 or 5.50 per hour, which in my opinion is an absolutely ridiculous fee. And also, please note that there are no coffee/tea making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “just average”
Reviews.Author: mccookie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the middle of October. Overall, it was just average. The room itself was clean, but the window did not open, nor did the air conditioner work. When brought to the attention of the reception, they sent someone to "fix it", which mostly involved adjusting the switches (that we had already done). Thankfully it was not too warm during that time of year, but it left the room with stale air. The buffet breakfast was adequate and the hotel itself clean and accessible to many attractions. Adequate hotel for a place to rest, but nothing spectacular (it may be a different story in hot weather....). No internet access in the rooms, and the "shared" internet is one slow computer outside the breakfast area, where you pay per timed usage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: family4cheshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great locatation in the marina area and is pretty central for everything . Everything is in easy walking distance. The room was comfortable and very clean. Lovely , clean hotel with a very good buffet breakfast .It is spoiled by the reception staff who were quite disinterested and were not very polite. The open top bus tours are a great way of seeing Barcelona and learning about the history and culture. A beautiful city, a must to see.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent staying”
Reviews.Author: K F
Reviews.Content: We were staying there in the middle of October 2011 for 3 days. It was excellent. I can not tell you any negative comments about it. The staff was kind and helpful, the room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was delicious and fresh even before the closing. The hotel is in a good place. You can reach a lot of things easily and by walk also. The rail station, two metrolines are very closed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Apathetic Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: viajera2001
Reviews.Content: Overall rating was great, but the front desk staff was less than helpful and not particularly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “It was better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: Debra C
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel del Mar in Barcelona by doing research online. We wanted a hotel that would be easy to get to from the cruise terminal after our 31 day Mediterranean cruise. It’s always a good idea to stay overnight at your final destination before catching your flight home. The reason we did it was because it takes time to disembark from the cruise ship and we had to be at the airport 3 hours ahead of time. From the port to the main entrance of town is a long wait. Although the cruise lines offer a shuttle at a minimal price, the wait can be over an hour. That applies to taxis also. You are not allowed to walk from the port in Barcelona, besides which it would be a very long walk (though it doesn’t look like it on the map). I searched for a hotel at a reasonable price that would be close to the cruise terminal because no matter what, we would have to take a taxi to the airport and there are very few hotels that offer shuttle service. Las Ramblas is a major tourist attraction and is the central drop off point for the shuttle buses. The statue of Christopher Columbus rests at the foot of Las Ramblas which is the first attraction you see. Our hotel was an eight minute walk down the straight and smooth Passeig de Colon walkway. It is a safe and interesting walk. It’s hard to get lost as long as you continue in a straight line that connects to d’Isabel 11. Make a right turn on Pla del Palau and the hotel is just ahead on the right. You will see the Nautical building across the street. It is across from a little park and a very short walk to the best tapas bar in Barcelona, El Vaso de Oro, in Ciutat Vella/Balboa 6, 08003. El Vaso de Oro has all great reviews and lives up to them. We arrived in Barcelona on a Sunday so we had to wait till four until they opened. The rest of the week, they may be open for lunch as well, but I am not sure of the times. Although to stroll along the beautiful Passeig de Joan de Bordo along the marina with all the tempting outdoor restaurants to sway you, you will never forget this little tasty tapas bar tucked away in an alley just a few steps from the main drag. I chose the Hotel del Mar for several reasons; the reviews were good, the location was perfect for us (close to the cruise terminal), it was inexpensive, and it was very close to El Vaso de Oro. This was our last destination, and I wanted our food experience to be memorable. Though we had the most wonderful food on our cruise ship, The Nieuw Amsterdam, I’ll never forget the foie gras at El Vaso de Oro. The hotel was clean, the service helpful and our room though we never asked for anything special, room had a huge terrace overlooking the whole area. They provided chairs, chaise lounges and an umbrella for us to end our day with a relaxing atmosphere. It was quiet and peaceful, a perfect place to end our long journey. If we were going to remain for another day, we could have hopped on the city bus that stops right out front and went on some sightseeing adventures, but we just wanted a day to relax before our long trip back to Arizona. I took some pictures of our terrace and view. Thanks for reading this and I hope wherever you end up in Barcelona, your experience will be as good as ours.

Reviews.Title: “Descent hotel at a good location”
Reviews.Author: Margaritha83
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay here. The bed's weren't too comfortable, and the air conditioner didn't really cool the room very well. But the staff was nice, rooms were clean and the location was really good. Walking distance from the beach. Considering the price, it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: YolandeL
Reviews.Content: We were sent to this hotel after our original booking was at a partner hotel [Rialto] and they had an air conditioning problem. We were a bit disappointed that we would not be staying off La Rambla in the centre of the city which was the reason that we booked Rialto and instead we would be at Hotel Del Mar which is near to Port Vell but we were pleased with the overall experience. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The rooms and the bathroom were both up to par. The hotel staff was friendly and spoke good English. The breakfast was quite good with enough variety to suit the palate [cereal, fruit, bread of various types, cheese, sausages, eggs, tea, coffee, juice etc]. If you are a touist the location means you have to walk about 10 minutes to Columbus Centre to find your bearings but it is not so far away that you are isloated from all other activities. From Columbus you can make your way to Playa Cataluna to get all the transfers [bus/taxi/train] to the airport etc. It is good value for money and I would recommend that someone stays there if he/she is looking for a good hotel at a budget price.

Reviews.Title: “It was just okay”
Reviews.Author: caldispatcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice, once with two the second with 3 in the room (same trip - Oct 2009). It was twice what we paid for another hotel and was nothing special. It was clean but tiny and cramped (which is true of a lot of hotels in Barcelona, I would think). The service was almost non-existent....if I remember, they served breakfast which was so so. We didn't even take photos of the inside of the room because it was just a room.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back”
Reviews.Author: IandD46
Reviews.Content: Great location near the port. our room was on the 4th floor and had roof top balcony. clean and very comfortable. staff friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: PauloRebelo
Reviews.Content: it's a excellent 3stars hotel. it's magnificient located near the rumblas and in the otherside the beach and the walkdown! I went to visit barcelona so we just slept in the room! the staff is real nice and always ready to serve and to help!if i return it's really good hotel and i will return because it's not too expensive and it's nice

Reviews.Title: “A bit lacking in some important areas”
Reviews.Author: LauraJoshua
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights this Summer. The place was clean, in a good location for going out or getting to the main attractions (close to the metro), which was lucky because we were contemplating leaving after a sleepless night - no air-conditioning and no fly screens on the windows. If you decide to stay here in Summer, invest in a mosquito repellent to plug into the wall, but in all honesty this should not be your problem.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in seedy location”
Reviews.Author: Sharon8822
Reviews.Content: Whilst our room was clean & tidy it was very basic. We had a safe in the room but had to pay for a key to lock it. Was not serviced the three days we were there. Free continental breakfast was ordinary. The hotel was located in a building with vacant boarded up shops on either side and one night even had someone sleeping in one of the doorways in a sleeping bag. On the up side, it had a bus stop right at the front door, was walking distance to most things and was a stone's throw away from the Hop on Hop Off Tourist bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Banking on location”
Reviews.Author: MrKeenFoodie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for a weekend. The hotel's location can't be faulted as it is right between the city and the beach (easy 5mins walk to both directions). We stayed in a room on the 4th floor and really made use of our private terrace. Unfortunately, that is where the pros end. The hotel's decor is questionable, breakfast is not included in the rate and there is no wi-fi. The front desk service was ok but nothing to rave about. Our main complaint was the use of really harsh cleaning products and air fresheners in the room. No proper toiletries were provided. Will definitely find somewhere else next time I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were excellent”
Reviews.Author: RWaters333
Reviews.Content: We cannot praise the staff of Hotel Del Mar more. Our Travel Agent had booked us in a twin room, we preferred a double. The Manager moved us to a fabulous room with a roof-top garden. The room itself was quite large with a roomy bathroom. We loved the area the hotel was in. Close to a lovely piazza, the On Off bus stop is close by and we enjoyed our drinks at the nearby Irish Pub. The Marina is a stone's throw away, with La Ramblas are 10 to 15 minute stroll from Del Mar. We would definately return there, but would book direct or through another Agent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mari1104
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the early part of May. This is a very decent hotel, good room size, very nice bathrooms. I wasn't as happy with the location as others were, it is much closer to the marina and it's about a 15 min walk to the Rambla. I wish we would have been closer. Not close to plaza Catalunya at all. Breakfast was great! They have a great coffee machine! Staff was helpful and friendly. They do however charge for usage of the safety box! I wasn't expecting that. Overall I do think this was a nice comfortable hotel, however if I were to return I'd go elsewhere only to be closer to the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, traditional and functional, Certainly worth looking up!”
Reviews.Author: hollinsider
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 306- it was a large room, nicely furnished and modern. The location was nice as it was overlooking a square close to the harbour. When we first turned up we thought we had the wrong hotel- it's really smart and very keenly priced too. Breakfast was functional and there was a fair range. (Coffee was brilliant) Staff were really quite helpful- we got a phone call to ask if we needed anything or a service on the second day. A coffee point in the room might be a nice idea- but I think that's nitpicking! - I'd recommend it : Ideally located to walk a big circle from the hotel up las ramblas and along through the parks. Lovely and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: JillJ0nes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Del Mar for 3 nights and were very happy with our choice of hotel. The location is great as it is less than a 5 minute walk from Estacio de Franca train station. It is right next to the marina and a very pleasant 15 minute walk along the harbour to the Colombus monument at the bottom of La Rambla. We had a top floor room (405) which had a big patio balcony with superb views. The room was very nice and comfortable with good bathroom and great shower! Our towels were changed every day and everywhere was really clean. Breakfast was really good in a very pleasant buffet breakfast room (the eggs were great!!). The hotel were happy to lock our luggage away on our last day as our flight departed in the evening and it meant we didnt have to take it around with us. I would definitely recommend the Del Mar and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “well located and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: 000eric000
Reviews.Content: Was located there for Mobile World Congress so I suppose that prices were doubled/trippled. Offer and Demand :-) Well located, not far from sea and beach for jogging. Near the harbor. Breakfast quite ok and room was clean. Unfortunately the cleaning team is using a parfum spray into the room which smells like toilet cleaning stuff. Opening the windows and problem easy solved

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay if it was not for the smell”
Reviews.Author: lad3011
Reviews.Content: We booked a cheap package tour with easyjet and stayed for 4 days in this hotel. The location of the hotel is quite good, just 7 minutes walk from Ramble, almost on the beach. Getting from the airport takes at least 1hour - if you are lucky with the train, which runs every 30 minutes. Note that the transfer from the regional train ( 4 stops from the airport) to the metro train station Passeig de Gracis in the city centre takes ca 13 minutes - a very long tunnel with lots of staircases. We did not find another way to avoid these tunnels and lots of places of interest require travel through this station! The room and hotel itself are quite modern and convenient. However, the smell in the bathroom was Really Bad and seemed to get particularly worse in the evening. We did not change the room on the first day because it did not seem to be that bad and I have read the reviews about the problem with smell in Barcelona in general. The breakfast was ok, though not fantastic. There was a coffee machine which for some reason made only sweet coffee. Overall it was a nice hotel but make sure to get a non-smelly room. I visited their toilets on the 1 st floor and they were perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: norcalamatt
Reviews.Content: Despite all the reviews stating that the staff was unfriendly, I found them to be quite helpful when asked. The location itself was perfect, and we were able to walk or take the metro everywhere we wanted to go. My only complaint was that the beds were not very comfortable but I would definately stay here again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: aussieduo69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at this hotel. The best thing about this hotel is the location, less than 5 min walk away from the main train station and about a 10 min walk to La Rambla. The hotels fee wifi wasnt wokring during our stay. The service from the staff at the hotel was below average. The room was ok but a door stop placed in the walkway between the bed and wall provided a perfect tripping hazard as we both found out. Breakfast was good providing a large choice of options.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap”
Reviews.Author: travelingERdoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap, you can take that as a positive or negative. But it's not some great bargain. You get what you pay for. The rooms are small with about a couple of feet of floor space forming a perimeter around the bed. The towels are cheap, the mattresses are cheap. There is nothing complementary whatsoever. You have to pay for the storage box, there isnt even complementary shampoo. Granted, you really shouldnt be spending alot of time in your hotel room on vacation anyway. But what disturbed me, and why I am writing such a bad review, was something that happened the second night I stayed there. At about 1 AM, the fire alarm goes off. So I go downstairs with the other guests using stairwell. And the guy at the front desk tells us, "dont worry about it, false alarm, it goes off sometimes when the temperature rises." I was like, (1) it's not even hot out, it's only about 60 degrees, (2) how do you know the "temperature rising" wasnt an actual fire, seeing as how he didnt investigate, and (3) what the hell kind of fire alarm is this that goes off randomly in the middle of the night like that? How do you know that it WILL go off when you want it too? I'm all for saving money on hotels during vacation. But it concerns me alot that the hotel has a mal-functioning fire alarm system. And doesnt seem too concerned about it. Needless to say, I didnt sleep too well the rest of that night (I was on the top floor). I wont be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel at perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sydney_travel000
Reviews.Content: Location is superb - walk to everything. Room was big and clean, staff was friendly, but but I didn't interact with them much. Overall the hotel offers a great value for money, much more than I would've expected for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Post Cruise Location”
Reviews.Author: RLRaceGirl
Reviews.Content: Like many of the other reviews, we found this hotel clean with decent sized rooms. We have stayed at other 4 star hotels in Europe with smaller rooms, this was a delight and we had a balcony looking out on a park. The location is what is really good, the Barcelona Tourist bus has 2 stops close by, the Cathedral area with all of its shops and restaurants are walking distance, and the only mall/shops open on Sunday are also walking distance. The staff was not terribly helpful with restaurant recommendations, just told us to go in a certain direction to find several and the one they did recommend was very "touristy". All said, great stay that includes a buffet breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice position and decently-sized rooms...”
Reviews.Author: pinnovel
Reviews.Content: Nice position and decently-sized rooms, but there was a terrible flaw and staff didn't do anything about it. The bathroom plumbing at least in room 403 gives off an awful smell, sometimes making it really hard to breathe in the room. Staff read obviously aware of that as they didn't so much as raise an eyebrow when confronted. There wasn't vacancy to let us so switch to an equivalent room, but staff really didn't so anything else: call a plumber? Nada. But would it have been so hard to just refill the deodorant system that was already installed in the bathroom, which I asked in both Spanish and English? This is no coincidence, as also evidenced by other reviews. It's a known problem for which the hotel us doing nothing but taking your money and saying “hi.” When they're in the mood for greetings, that is...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, smart, modern hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Penelope_Pitstop24
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a girlfriend during a long weekend to Barcelona, the hotel is in an excellent location and just five minutes walk from Port Vell and the beach. The hotel is very clean and very modern, one of the receptionists was a bit stroppy but apart from that it was superb! I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Texastravellers2010
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the location of Hotel Del Mar. We were close to the beach and at the edge of the Gothic District. Our room was clean, roomy and confortable; it was located on the top floor so we had our own private rooftop terrance...very nice. A wonderful breakfast was served every morning. We found the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay again”
Reviews.Author: Travel_relax_10
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel in my oppinion if you want to experience Barcelona and you're interested in both going to the beach and seeing the sites. This hotel offers both within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Would pick it again”
Reviews.Author: holertingrid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located only one block away from the Barceloneta. Easy and safe walk. The rooms are small (at least the one I had) but it is well provided and the bathroom is indeed big and comfortable. Very charming and modern at the same time. Breakfast was good and plenty. The front desk clerks had not too much idea abou anything since we asked them about the internet options and they said the hotel has no internet at all and we've go to a cyber place a couple of blocks away...well...the hotel DOES have an internet station (which you can access with a c.card - very expensive though and the mousse did not work). But honestly, a hotel without WIFI in 2010 is quite a disadvantage and brings the qualifying points down. Front desk, once again, was not very informative and they were there just to do what they are paid for: check in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: grannyfeve
Reviews.Content: Superb location that is both central and enhanced by the port facilities with cooling sea breeze and adjacent to the old town. Good value hotel recently refurbished with quiet rooms and good air conditioning. Breakfasts, beds and bathrooms all very good. No in house bar or restaurant but many adjacent choices available. I would stay here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but ignorant staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sockerbiten
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at Hotel Del Mar for 4 nights at the end of May. The location of the hotel was great, both close to the the harbour and to the central parts of the city. The room felt clean and was nicely furnished and the bathroom felt also clean and fresh. The view from our balcony wasn't the best, we lookted straight in to a brick wall :-), but could see the port with its sailboats if we looked to the right. Overall our stay was pleasant, but there were a few things that made us think less of the hotel, for example felt the staff very ignorant. When we exited/entered the hotel during a day they sometimes didn't even look up from what they were doing to say "Hi". Like they didn't care who entered the hotel. There was a hole in one wall in our room which they hadn't tryed to repair, the aircondition didn't work (maybe it isn't put on until June, I don't know) and a homeless man used to sleep like 20 meter from the hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Small hotel in the center of the town”
Reviews.Author: Icecream26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this nice little hotel in December last year. The location was super and every attraction of the city could be reached easily. Ramlas is walkable from the hotel. The rooms are small but clean. There is no kettle in the room plus there is no room service so, bed tea was a bit of a problem for us. The staff is polite and helpful. My suitcase was left behind by the airline and the hotel staff was kind enough to collect it. There are plenty of eating joints around the hotel which are reasonably priced. The best part of the hotel was the huge spread of breakfast which was very very nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but I didn't fall in love with it.”
Reviews.Author: CichoSzaa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine. It's clean and the staff is helpful, which is most important. Breakfast was tasty with a big choice of different things. I personally had two problems in my room with temperature - it was extremely cold. Even if I set the air condition to 30 degrees it didn't change anything. Also it was very loud even after turning off. That was very annoying in the night. I know it was only in my room and my colleagues didn't have this problem. also there are only Spanish tv channels and Wi-Fi didn't work. But all in all it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_relax_10
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I loved our stay at Hotel Del Mar. We stayed there for one week and the hotel was located perfectly close to the marina, the beach and the center of the town. This is allmost impossibel to find. The breakfast was delicious. The only con to this was that the person who was responsibel for catering the breakfast overslept the day we had to leave which complicated our departure. I would highly recommend this hotel to everybody and I'm going back in the summer of 2010 because nothing i could find compared to this hotel when it comes to location, price and has breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in handy location”
Reviews.Author: fleur1104
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its quiet location (after having stayed on the Ramblas last year we learnt our lesson!) and it was fairly quiet for the most part. It was very handy for the hop on/hop off tourist bus as there's a stop just on the other side of the square, and also a metro station 2 minutes walk away. The rooms were quite large and had good air con. Staff on the front desk were helpful and firendly enough, though we had to change our room key cards several times as they didn't work. The 'American' breakfast had a good choice and included a bit of everything. Coffee from the machine wasn't great though. Overall it was a good place to stay for its proximity to the port and restaurants of Barceloneta and also very handy for the Ramblas and other tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, No Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MHTruett
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Del Mar is a nice clean hotel - a good value for the money. The staff is attentive and friendly. The rooms are relatively small but that was understood when we booked the hotel. The bathrooms are small as well. We had an upper floor room with a patio which was nice and close to the same size as the room. There are vending machines and a small cafeteria available on the second floor. The hotel is a good value for the money. The location is great – a few blocks off the Las Ramblas near the marina. You are just steps or a few blocks from a number of good restaurants. Barcelona is relatively easy to walk around and this hotel is a good location to venture out from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Douglas9Uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel del Mar in August 2009 when the temperature was 36C + and 30C at midinight. The air conditioning was enough to reduce the temp. to about 23C at night, though it had to be turned on and off as the blast of cool air was directed at the face of anyone sleeping in bed. This hotel was functional - comfortable and clean but nothing out of the ordinary - a bit impersonal perhaps, but efficient. For such hot conditions there is an amazing absence of any sort of insects in Barcelona, even flies! It is excellently situated, good for transport (Barceloneta metro and Estacio de Francia are a short walk away) and for the Barrio Gotico, with the Ramblas beyond, and the beach (Barceloneta), though you may wish to go further up the coast (also easy by bus, which stops outside the hotel) for more attractive beaches. The Museo del Arte de Catalunya, nearby, is worth a visit. I followed the tip of another Tripadvisor member who recommended the Cafe Bubo for breakfast (opposite the church of Santa Maria del Mar, nearby - walk due North - which is also interesting). Much better then the overpriced buffet breakfast at the hotel. Lots of good restaurants nearby in the Gothic Quarter - I found La Fonda (C. dels Escudellers) very good for lunch (1 pm to 3.45 pm) - 3 courses and 1/4 ltr wine for 9 Euros. Unfortunately I did not get the coveted top floor and my room was opposite neighbours in the C. Reina Cristina - but the double-glazing and curtains are efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: StephanieJung
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago I was in Barcelona, and even though I was stayin at my friend's, we had to stay in a Hotel for the weekend. We chose Hotel del Mar because our friend had a discount coupon for it offerd by some Local guide or something like that. The location is a little bit separated, but at the same time is closer to the beach than other hotels. The rooms where better than we expected, and the hotel, overall was ok, it didn't had many services, but you could deal with it. The Area where is located is not one of the best ones, but at least is not el Raval, where you will get robbed. I would recomend this hotel if the individual believes that the low price is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnaCaro-CostaRica
Reviews.Content: Internet access was out, hotel was average, location was good. Hotel was nothing fancy, but front desk people was very willing to help. In general no mayor mishaps, but nothing amazing to tell. Nice hotel if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed while sleeping in this hotel, do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: rabs1980
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do, do not stay in this. My husband and I were sleeping in our hotel rom where convieniently the airconditioning was not working, the window was closed but it led to another window which could be accessed from the corrdior of the hotel. A man ntered our room at 2am and stoel our passports, money and credit cards. My husband chased the man out of the room (who escaped through the window) into the corrdior and ran down the stairs yelling to stop at the top of his lungs. The 24 hr manned reception did not even bother to lock the door. You cannot get into this hotel without being granted access from reception! Reception then refused to call the police, security or even a manager. We got the feeing thi was an inside job despite the glowing reviews, holed up in our room till sunlight. Also interesting that someone else was sent to another hotel, we were sent to hotel del mar after our original hotel, owned by the same chain was overbooked. Police report has been lodged even thought we dont expect to recover anything, we just wanted to warn people. Apparently pickpocketers are not the only threat in Spain. The beginning of our 10 year anniversary holiday ruined, we are just trying to get passports etc....whatever you do don´t stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel del Mar/Medinaceli Hotel switchoff”
Reviews.Author: emsaSeattle
Reviews.Content: Apparently when you book Hotel Del Mar in Barcelona, they play a little game called "we are overbooked" and you are sent immediately by taxi (cab driver not too happy also) to Medinaceli Hotel with the excuse that you booked not directly with them and there is overbooking problem. Medinaceli is WAY overpriced for what you receive which is nothing. There is no graciousness, no amenities, and it was terrible as far as customer service. They recommended we use the Barcelona city tour bus and it was god-awful. The bus broke down. They take forever to pick you up, and the driver at one point yelled at some of the passengers who were riding on the upper deck for touching some tree leaves overhead. Then she yelled pretty much the entire time till we reached our drop off point. The wallpaper in the room is peeling, the staff does not speak English for the most part. They are surly and are on the computer messing around and want nothing to do with the guests. You do not receive any water, coffee or anything. The water from the tap tastes awful and it is a pretty depressing place overall. I will never return to this place. The location is not bad, but the area is very expensive for anything you wish to purchase. Do not book with either of these dreadful establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: earthtomark
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for a great price right in the middle of the best area's of Barcelona. I don't know what some of the other reviewers saw in terms of rudeness from the staff, but I did not experience it. Staff provided service as expected, maybe not over the top but for the price of the accommodation, more than enough. If you want an 'authentic' Barcelona experience you will have to travel out of the area, but you'll find it hard to drag yourself away from the Born district just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: BarnetBeachbabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Hotel Del Mar in mid-November. Check in was quick and we were able to leave our cases on our final day once we had checked out of our room so we had more time for sightseeing. We had requested in advance a top floor room with terrace - not available on arrival but we were moved to one of these rooms on the second day of our stay. Would recommend asking for one of these rooms if you are a summer visitor - sun bed and table with chairs. Rooms were fairly small but newly refurbished and cleaned well. Water was lovely and hot. The heavy curtains would be good for blocking early morning summer sunshine. Breakfast was fine - despite some other reviews. Eggs, bacon and potato omelette, cereals, croissants and other pastries as well as ham and cheese and bread available for toasting. The hotel is in a very convenient spot - about 4 minutes from Estacion Francia - which is about15 minutes from Sants. There is a touristica bus stop a couple of minutes away - we took a two day buss pass and really got our use out of it. Don't miss the Montjuic bit - lovely views and lots of Olympic interest. The beach is good too - for a better time of year. We had sunny weather but it was chilly on the open top bus. Good choice of restaurants within 5 mins walk in the Port Vell area. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dawny66
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 day trip on my own to enjoy the city and the beach and did both. The Hotel Del Mar was a great place for a stay, really close to the harbour, 10 mins from the beach and 10 mins from the centre, and very close to the Metro stop (barceloneta) perfect. Rooms were clean and big, I didn't get the best view from my room but I wasn't in my room much so didn't matter too much. Lots of good restaurants close by and I felt really safe in the area at night. Don't bother with the breakfast, you miss the delights of a breakfast in a tradtitional cafe in the Bari Gothica area. If you go to the beach don't bother with the main one near the harbour, it gets very crowded and isn't great, its worth a short bus trip or a nice walk along the front to a beach further down, much nicer. Would recommend the Barcelona bike tour, fantastic value for money and a perfect way to see Barcelona. El Rey de la Gamba restaurant on the harbour front is fantastic for seafood, looks a bit like a touristy place but well worth a go, especially the Mussels or the Langostines - Fab.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, good value, but overrated”
Reviews.Author: yankancuch
Reviews.Content: This is a good value for central Barcelona, and conveniently located with modern, clean, comfortable rooms. However, I think the tripadvisor ratings make it sound better than it is. The rooms are good, but the hotel itself is somewhat dreary. It could be the dark portico entrance, or the narrow oddly un-hotel like reception area, or the somewhat aloof, not always very professional staff (while we were there, the only staff member was a very young man who was dressed for a night in the clubs). It could be the location: though technically close to lots of sights (especially the gothic quarter), the waterfront area of Barcelona still feels isolated. So you don't really feel like you're in the heart of it all. It's a good hotel with good rates, but nothing to rave about, and I'd probably only stay there again if it was significantly cheaper than the alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: Babooska
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona in February and stayed at Hotel Del Mar. I think that the location is really good, just 10 minutes from city center. The hotel is clean and staff professional even if a bit cold. Anyway I suggest it!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was shocking”
Reviews.Author: Jeggles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise. Unfriendly unhelpful reception - first impressions not good. (The man on front desk next day was a bit better). Had 2 huge bags and a couple of carry bags, and no help was offered to take them to the room. Air Con wasn't good - hard to keep the room cool. Our rate included breakfast, but it was not value for money - almost inedible. I wasn't even permitted to take a cup of tea up to my room. Could not get ice to take back to our room either. Postives: Great location, clean rooms. Handy to nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Terrace”
Reviews.Author: zolo
Reviews.Content: I didn't book this hotel because of it's rating (it languishes in the 70's and 80's) but because of the uniformly good ratings given by the readers. They were right! We had one of those trips where I kept getting a primo room. I wish I could tell you the secret. Maybe it was booking early. Maybe it was not quibbling over price. Maybe it was checking-in around noon. And finally, maybe it was because I walked in there with my Tripadvisor cap on! Hey, it couldn't hurt. Everything the readers have been saying about location is true. The hotel is well placed for the Gothic quarter, the Ramblas, the Metro, the Bus Touristique and the port area. The hotel is well organized, clean and safe. A good value for Barcelona. The real surprise was the terrace as I was not prepared for how spacious and private it was. When we were there the weather was hot and the terrace was like an oven during the day. We couldn't help ourselves and washed some clothes in the bath and aired them out. In the morning and evening we could sit very comfortably outside in our own private paradise. Wonderfull! Another tip (which I am sure the Hotel would not want me to give out) is that in hot weather get two keys. Take one on your adventuring and use the other to keep the electricity in the room activated so that the room is tolerable when you come back. Here are some petty negatives. I couldn't find a good patisserie nearby to pick-up a light breakfast to eat out on the terrace. We looked at the Hotel breakfast (9 euros) but it was not that appealing. Periodically a foul odour would emanate from the bathroom (not me!) but it would disappear just as fast. Despite this, I would go back here in a heartbeat. For a dining tip, I suggest the plaza opposite the nearby Santa Maria del Mar church (a grand gothic). A place called Bubo has a meagre 4 tables out in the courtyard. We found that they take the pain out of ordering Tapas by having a neat prix fixe, but I would still order a la carte. It was cheap but tasty and made to order. Try it before it goes out of business.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: irishmm
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on Tripadvisor recommendations, and were not disappointed. We had a one-night stay in Barcelona, which was much too short! Making return plans already. We came off a cruise boat in Barcelona Harbor, and had a cab ride of about 10 Euros to the hotel, which is not far from the foot of Las Ramblas and is also within walking distance of the beach. The room was immaculately clean, with modern shower and comfortable bed. The hotel staff spoke fairly good English, and were generally helpful to us. An in-room safe was available for extra charge. We didn't try the breakfast buffet (also available at extra cost). Our room was quiet. Our only complaint was that the air conditioning, on a very warm day in Barcelona, never seemed to work well. Problem solved (sort of) by opening the doors to our outside porch at night. We had room #409, which is a corner room facing north. Huge balcony, with lounge chairs, umbrella, and small table and chairs. We recommend this room! Suggestion: Confirm prices first before eating/drinking at restaurants on Las Ramblas. Prior to our cruise, we paid 8.50 Euros for single glasses of Sangria on Las Ramblas. Following the cruise (lesson learned), we had wonderful (reasonably priced) paella and sangria (8 Euros for a liter) on a side street off Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Generally good hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Phil of England
Reviews.Content: Others have given this hotel rave reviews, and certainly I've stayed in plenty worse places. Reception staff were friendly, our room was fine, the hotel generally had modern decor and was well located (metro line R10 runs from airport to nearby Francia station). The air conditioning in our room worked fine (essential in Barcelona in summer) but it might not in yours: the hotel staff were unable to find a room in which the A/C worked properly for another member of our party. But the big let-down is the breakfast, which is a standard buffet, understaffed (so things that ran out weren't getting replaced) and the "hot" food was cold and extremely unappetising. Overall, I'd stay at this hotel again - but I'd have breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: pennyKansas
Reviews.Content: After a terrible London hotel, we were pleased to find that our Barcelona hotel was very nice and modern. This hotel is very close to Las Ramblas and other attractions, yet quiet at night. There is a metro station a few yards away so that is convenient. It was cleaned very well daily and the front desk people generally helpful. The beds were comfortable but a bit strange that 2 twin beds were put together to make a double. The hotel breakfast buffet was pricey considering you could get much cheaper pastries and coffee nearby. My husband and I loved the tapas bar nearby (take 2 lefts from the hotel) and found it to be much cheaper than eating near the Ramblas (DON'T do that, it is overpriced). There is a restaurant right beside the hotel (7 Portes) that is very nice looking but completely overpriced for the taste and amount of food you get. The only "problem" was that we had no view to the outside from our hotel window--we could only see walls and another hotel room so if you like a view, you might request it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AMTManhattanBeach_CA
Reviews.Content: My Sister and I just returned from a Mediterranean Cruise. Stayed first in Barcelona at the Hotel Del Mar for two nights and loved it! Had a nice, clean, large and contemporary room that also had a large bathroom with powerful shower and good hair dryer. The location near the waterfront was also excellent, a nice walk to the Picasso museum, Gothic area and Ramblas. It was also a quick cab ride to the pier for our ship. Really the only negative was the Front Desk staff, who were unfriendly and unhelpful. Still, I would definitely stay there again! Manhattan Beach, CA 5/08

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: psychosocs
Reviews.Content: Booked via alpharooms.com and 'requested' a double room. Got it, and dead chuffed to find we also had a roof terrace, a wonderful, private little sun-trap for those few moments we weren't lapping up Barcelona's amazing atmosphere. Room 411 comes highly recommended given the price, mainly due to the terrace, but the standard of the room itself was also reasonably spacious, totally clean, modern and a genuinely pleasant place to be. Service was excellent throughout, even down to the consierge running out into the street to hail us a cab when the one he'd called an hour before let him down! Location is perfect...2 minutes walk from Barceloneta metro station, 2 minutes from Port Vell, 10 minutes from Drassanes and the end of Las Ramblas. Lots of great restaurants / bars really closeby, including the fashionable Born area. Essentially you step out of the hotel and within a few minutes you're gaping in awe at some great architecture or similar. On the down-side (albeit a small downer), breakfast is Very average, but does the job and kept us going until the 'proper' lunchtime of 2pm onwards.

Reviews.Title: “definitely reasonable hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Frk_D
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a central and very reasonable hotel with an excellent location and a breakfast buffet that gives you the energy to tour the city all day - stay a the Delmar! This is my second time to the city and my second time staying in the area, which is located right in between the Born and Barcaloneta ares -and I love it and will be staying here the next time as well....

Reviews.Title: “Total satisfaction.”
Reviews.Author: JourneymanEngland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 nights at the Hotel del Mar, our first visit to Barcelona. The hotel and its staff are all first rate. It is spotlessly clean and the excellent breakfast is all one might hope for - and available from 0700-1030am, very civilised for older holidaymakers. The location could hardly be better. Public transport immediately available, the Gothic Quarter just across the road, restaurants along the marina - the Emperador is excellent - and lovely walks so simple to the beach and many parts of the city. I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family and, when we return to Spain, I shall look for other hotels in the Grupo Gargallo, the owners of Hotel del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “First Time To Barcelona - Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Charlee61
Reviews.Content: Highly Recommend! Great Hotel! Spotless Room! Charming Staff! Good Breakfast! 7 Portes Restaurant next door to Hotel Excellent !!

Reviews.Title: “A nice little city hotel”
Reviews.Author: ells32
Reviews.Content: Booked this on location , only to find on arrival it wasn't quite where I was expecting to be , but wasn't too far for it to be a problem . Only a 10 minute walk to the Ramblas and 100 meters to the nearest metro station , the Gothic Quarter and all it's back streets were just a block away . Booked a triple room and it was a really good size , 3 single beds and all the mod cons , plus a rather large bathroom , large windows on two sides with views of the port and a plaza , couldn't be happier . Breakfast was okay , nothing exceptional but it was all presented well and there was plenty of each thing . The only problem was the tables were small which made space an issue once you added plates and cups etc . Was only there for one night for the Champions League so can't say how handy it was for restaurants or bars , but in the day there seemed to be a few things close by and with the Gothic Quarter around the corner I would imagine it was all within walking distance . All in all I was more than happy with my booking especially as it's the first time I've not stayed on the Ramblas . I would certainly look into stopping there again and recommend it to friends .

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carrick-family
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via hotelopia.com on recommendations from previous reviews on this site. We were not disappointed. Check-in took all of 2 minutes. Staff were extremely helpful and polite. Hotel was spotlessly clean and very modern. We stayed in room 206 which was spacious and had views across the square. The hotel is situated in the port area, 10 mins from La Ramblas and the beach. Barcelonetta metro station (L4) was just across the road. The touristic bus stop was a 2 min walk away. Breakfast was good (9 euros) with a selection of cooked food, bread, rolls, muffins, cold meats, cheese, fruit & yogurts. There was a safety deposit box in the room (2 euros per day). I would recommend using the touristic bus as soon as you can, as this is a great way of finding restaurants and places of interest within close proximity of the hotel. 3 routes available on the tour - 2 hours for red and blue route and 40 mins for green route. Barcelona is a great city - enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: AndyB_Glasgow
Reviews.Content: I was tempted not to write a review for this hotel, because I don't want it to become too popular! I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. It is convenient for the port, beaches, town, park. It is very clean and quiet. I would suggest trying to get a room on a floor above the second floor. To think I almost never stayed in this hotel because I read a review which said it was not so convenient for the Metro. What tosh - it is about 100m away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Explorer91
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews and happy to say that we had a very enjoyable stay. Went to Barcelona for a short city break with father and had two main criteria that the hotel needed to fulfil 1) good location & 2) clean. The hotel scores top marks at both. Being situated by the marina meant that there was a short 10 minute walk to the Ramblas and same duration in opposite direction to the many seafood restaurants along the marina front. Cannot fault cleanliness throughout the hotel, room was cleaned every day and hotel was in good repair. If you're after good room views and 4/5 star facilities then this is not the right hotel but if you want an affordable, clean and well located base to explore Barcelona then this hotel ticks the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Super little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JC05
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Barcelona and after staying further out last time, we chose this hotel based on its reviews and closeness to the centre. We were not disappointed. This hotel is perfectly placed to explore the Barri/Gothic centre. It is just across the road from the tube and Bus Turistic stop. It is also a quick walk to La Ramblas and the marina. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and we felt safe at all times. The hotel is clean, our room was serviced daily and the staff were helpful. We went with another couple and they were lucky enough to get a room with a roof balcony. The views of the marina, local area and olympic village were fantastic. Breakfast is buffet style and is limited but it was adequate for our needs. It costs 9 euros pp if not in your booking. We really liked this little hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: sophalina
Reviews.Content: Very affordable. Very nicely decorated, clean, staff very helpful. Made reservations for us for dinner. Called taxis when we needed them. Great location. We will definitely stay here again when we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Galtech
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short trip to Barcelona staying at Hotel Del Mar. The hotel appears to have been refurbished recently, our room (117) was immaculate. The shower/bath was excellent. The room was slightly on the small side, but I'm there to see the city, not the hotel room! Our room didn't have mini bar or tea/coffee facilities, I don't know if other rooms do. This didn't matter too much as on the first floor there's vending machines selling hot and cold drinks, plus snacks. The location is excellent, only a few minutes walk from Estacio De Franca (which has direct trains/busses to the airport), Barcaloneta Metro station, and also just a few minutes from the marina and Barri Gotic, both of which have an abundance of restaurants/bars. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here if/when I return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: qqtjen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our recent trip to Spain. The location is excellent - especially if you do the hop on/hop off bus tour. We bought a 2 day pass and used the bus tour as our transportation around the city. However, the rooms and bathrooms were miniscule! Two people could barely be in the room at the same time! The air conditioning did not work very well, and the room was very hot all the time. Although we had a private roof deck, we never used it as we were out exploring the city. They do have internet, but you have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base while travelling on my own.”
Reviews.Author: Teen0206
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Del Mar for a trip earlier this month through Lastminute.com and have to say the hotel was a bargain. I got the bus from the airport to Catalunya, walked down Las Ramblas and along the sea front. The hotel was clean, quiet and modern. It is also just over the road from the harbour and near to the beach, just on the edge of La Ribera, which was an area I really liked. I went up Las Ramblas one night for dinner but it was not an enjoyable experience, I was constantly getting called at, proposition and got followed to a resturant by a man that hung around outside. Next night I went a walk in La Ribera round from the hotel, which was lovely. The blue route or the tourist bus actually passes the outside of the hotel too. I would definatley stay here again, I did not try the breakfasts but would say this excellent value hotel in a nice area of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kath*46
Reviews.Content: great hotel. great location. newly refurbished. far enough away from the centre for a nice 10 min max walk to the Ramblas. We arrived in the wee small hours but no problems checking in. We had a really early morning flight home but hotel booked us a taxi to the bus station which was good. Didn't have the buffet breakfast so can't comment. Would definately go back and recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Definately going back !!”
Reviews.Author: katiebugs1
Reviews.Content: What a FANTASTIC place to stay ! We lucked out & got room 405, which is a corner room & has a HUGE balcony with one side overlooking the marina & the other overlooking the square. Nelson at the front desk was FANTASTIC. We had heard that the front desk staff don't speak much English, but he was GREAT. VERY helpful with everything from where to eat to how to get the train (a block away) back to the airport, to where to buy some pasteries. The Barcelona Touristic Bus stops in 2 places by the hotel less than a 2 minute walk away. La Ramblas is a short leasurily stroll away. At the advise of others, we actually did not go near La Ramblas after dark, which was fine as there were numerous fantactis restaurants right around the hotel and after a short stroll after our evening meal, we enjoyed returning to the hotel for a nightcap on our own private balcony and enjoying the views of the marina in one direction and the hills with the Catherdral light up on the top. WE also had a nice view of the Power Companies unique building. The buffet breakfast was your typical foods. Filled your belly in the morning, which is really all you need. Our room was very comfortable. Not overly large, but I haven't found a hotel room in Europe that is. I do have to agree that BBC World gets pretty boring watching after about 20 minutes. Even one additional English TV channel would give a little variety. Then again I have to remember that I am on holidays & do I really NEED TV? I am there to experience a different culture, not what I am used to at home. This is one hotel that we definately will be returning to and am counting the minutes until I can !!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mr.merlot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel del Mar in June having considered many hotel reviews on Tripadvisor. The only downside to the hotel for me was that the immediate area around the hotel was a little dark at night when the shutters go up to many shops selling electrical/household/jewellery. Incidently I was chuffed that I bought a neckless at one on the local shops and was offered discount without asking for it. I caught a taxi from the airport upon my arrival, but left by renfe train [line10]. The Estacio de France [train station] is very near the hotel and trains ran every 30 minutes [6am am first and 23:44pm last trains from airport, 5:12am first train and 22:42 last train from The Estacio de France. Stations in between (airport – Barcelona) are Passeig de Gracia, Barcelona-Saints, Bellvitige, El Prat de Llobregat. The hotel is within easy reach of the fish restaurants at the marina – I ate at the Cal Pinxo, great food, wine and brandy and good service but the portions were not big – and thank goodness for credit cards. I’d read about pick pocketing in Barcelona and was worried but I took sensible precautions that you should take in anywhere and I was OK. I was strolling along Las Ramblas one evening and was slightly startled by a lady offering me her services – I ignored her. The market of la Boqueria, just off Las Ramblas was an incredible contrast between colours and activity. It certainly makes English supermarkets look dull and worth a visit. Back to Hotel del Mar. It was clean, quiet, comfortable and spacious. My room overlooked a courtyard with views of the windows of other so the room had no view – but at least it was quite. I’d recommend this hotel and very much look forward to returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Location BUT!!”
Reviews.Author: Nelso
Reviews.Content: Great position but air-cond barely worked , luckily it was not too hot, we left the windows wide open only trouble then was the street noise never ceased until about 3 a.m.The room was clean . We booked for a double bed only got very small singles and they were rock hard,we were only there for 2 nights, long enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Biscuits27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Del Mar for 3 nights in August 2007. The hotel is in a good location, an easy 10 min walk to the Ramblas. The walk to/from the hotel is safe and we never felt like we were in danger even though we had heard the area was not great. The room was newly refurbished and was quite big. The room was clean and modern. The hotel is located very close to the tourist bus stop (2 min walk) which was very convenient. I would recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely location”
Reviews.Author: IntaCepta
Reviews.Content: very good location, 10 minutes from les ramblas, so its close enough to walk to, but far away from the noise. close to the beach. excellent room, very clean, bath room very clean. I would definately come back and stay here if I came back. to get here from the main train station Franc , when you exit the station, take a left, continue walking until you see a building with flags.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: BGHolland
Reviews.Content: NIce hotel, clean and comfortable rooms. Fantastic location in the heart of Barcelona. View on the harbour is only for a happy few...but with this location you won't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: LMLevicki
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel to the train station was unbeatable. We got off our train from France at 10 p.m. and our hotel was just a five minute walk away. It was close to metro stations and a great area with lots of restaurants and shops. It was also close to the marina, which was a nice evening walk, and Las Ramblas. The rooms were very clean and modern. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly, though we speak Spanish fluently, which might have helped. They had a cab waiting for us at 4 in the morning as we asked--no problems at all. Definitely request a room on the 4th floor. I believe all rooms on the 4th have a balcony that is really a veranda--they're quite large and you can see the city from there. They are private with tables and chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: michmar
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say what a fab hotel this is. It is situated about 10 minutes walk from the sea front and 15 minutes walk from La Rambla,you could probably walk it quicker but it was very hot!! The room we had 313 wasn't great for views but as we only were there to wash and sleep that wasn't a problem. Hotel staff very helpfull and even found us some ice so we could chill our bubbly!!! Also as the hotel isn't right in on La Rambla it was very peaceful once you did want to go to sleep. Only downfall no fridge or hotel bar ,but Barcelona was open all hours .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Tonia27
Reviews.Content: I just came back yesterday from Barcelona and me and my boyfriend stayed at del Mar. I didn't know what to expect since there was a review that said the service is bad there. Well, we didn't have that impression, all the staff was very nice, they've always helped us when we needed any information whatsoever. Everything was very clean, breakfast was good, rooms are nice. So I would definitely recommend Hotel del Mar in Barcelona, it was a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Service”
Reviews.Author: usabrett
Reviews.Content: The rooms and price were good, but I was disappointed in the attitudes of the hotel staff. They were the least friendly of any hotel staff I have ever visited in Europe. When asked a question, they responded with growls on their faces, especially when asked to speak English. I tip for good service, but I certainly did not tip anyone in this hotel and I will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good postion”
Reviews.Author: themonstersmam
Reviews.Content: Myself and five friends stayed here for one night pre cruise in May.This hotel is modern, very comfortable , very clean, very comfortable, reasonably pricedand in a very central position . The Bedrooms are of a good size and nicely decorated. The beds are comfortable and the pillows are the best vwe have ever laid our heads on.The breakfast was ok too. It is within close walking distance to port vell, beaches, the rambles and barcelonta. There are also many bars and resturants around this hotel to suit any taste or budget. We always take the train from and to the airport to barcelona. Franca station is just around the corner and 2 mins walk from this hotel ( we find this station easier to use than Barcelona sants station which is very busy and not centrally located as this). In the side street next to this( regina cristina )is a cava bar very cheap and some what of and experience!!!!Also within 5mins walk from this hotel on carrer de ginebra is a wonderful little tapas bar called Jai-ca. Its full of locals , the tapas are wonderful and also very reasonably priced. I would recommend this hotel, its ideal for any stay in Barcelona .

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzyIQ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night during May 2007. The room was very nice, modern & comfortable & extremely well situated. We were close to the rambles, the port & only a 5 minute walk from the station ( half an hour journey direct from the airport). The breakfast was ok but no more than that - the usual cold meats, cheese & bread & luke warm sausages, bacon & eggs but I wouldn;'t let this deter me from staying there again as it was very good value for money overall.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lucyfaraway
Reviews.Content: I booked a non-smoking room for 2 nights. I very much enjoyed my stay. The hotel's location is very convenient. It is about a three minute walk to the Barcelonetta metro stop and about the same to the Estacio Franca train station. Las Ramblas takes about 10-15 minutes to get to depending on which route you take. I was surprised at the size of the room because I expected something much smaller. But the room was very large. There was a petite foyer to close the room from the main door to the hallway. (See photos). The room was tastefully decorated and was incredibly comfortable. The doors to the balcony do have double paned glass so the street noise isn't as bad as it would be otherwise. I think the best feature of the hotel was its staff. The hotel staff was very friendly and and eager to help with any questions I had about the city. The front desk clerks were warm and always greeted me with a smile no matter the hour. I will most definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: zags40
Reviews.Content: We booked this sight unseen through a travel agent. We are American and have not traveled outside the USA much so we weren't sure what to expect. The location was perfect. We walked to the waterfront, museums and shopping. Finding a good close restaurant was a bit more of a challenge. Our first day we took a 1/2 day city tour which I highly recommend. The hotel rooms were clean and roomy enough for one or two people. My co-travelers had to be moved as their air conditioner didn't work. It was difficult working with the front desk and no one spoke English. Ever. The lobby was tiny and not made for lounging. The internet area was very hot and and nearly unbearable (in June). The breakfast was a good European type with variety. I would stay here again because it was centrally located, clean and modern. The only downside was the non-English speaking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynnj2468
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Barca three times now in three different hotels. The hotel is situated down near the port end of Le Ramblas very close to the railway station (great for getting a train back to the airport and for only 2.40 Euro Only refurbished this year rooms were modern/clean we were originally given a twin room, and had booked a double ,we asked the next morning if we could have a double room and were change immediately, to a double room over looking the road with a small balcony very nice. and quaint (however alittle noisy in the morning with traffic) A nice 10 min stroll to the bottom of la ramblas Breakfast ok, there is toast cereal bread ham cheese ,so enough to start the day (it was included in the price of our booking would not have like to pay the 9 euros for it . breakfast is till 10.30 but after 10 the items were not really refilled luggage room to store cases after checkout would definately go back to this hotel again as it was good value for money

Reviews.Title: “love the place!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gillybabe
Reviews.Content: having stayed here with my friend in april this year, i returned again with my hubby and daughter aged 6. we had a brilliant stay again,n the room was bigger and better this time with 2 balconies, my daughter enjoyed helping herself to the breakfast buffet and my husband filled up too. the rooms are kept very clean and the staff do their best despite the language problems! excellent location, all you could want from a city hotel and more, we will return again next year for the third time. go on give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FoxyLady64
Reviews.Content: The 3 star rating is understated. Fantastic hotel. Clean,comfortable,great buffet breakfast. Service was excellent. Staff polite & courteous,very helpful. Located near Port Vell. Don't be put off by the graffiti on the properties around the Hotel as it was commonplace wherever we went. A 10 min walk to Las Ramblas. Nearby to Marmagnum shopping centre. Some fantastic fish restaurants/tapas bars within a 2 min walk. 5mins to the beach. Try the restaurants the locals eat in for best value or look for the menu del dia sign. You get 3 courses for a fixed price. Anything from 9 euros - 15 euros. Lastly,if your sick of fish try the Fastnet Irish Bar for good food,hospitality & beer. 5 mins from Hotel Del Mar towards beach. At the rear of the Hotel Del Mar is a late night bar called La Cala. Cheapest beer or cerveza.sells Estrella Damm on draught cheap for 1/2 litre.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome change”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my eight year old daughter to Barcelona for a long weekend and was not happy when I found we had been moved from the hotel we had booked (The Santa Marta) to the Del Mar (receptionist at Santa Marta didn't speak enough english to explain why!) But what a result (especially now I have read the reviews of the Santa Marta). The hotel was excellent, clean, modern with friendly staff. The breakfast was average, with plenty of food, a wide choice and reasonable quality and certainly set us up for the day. Even my daughter (who can be extremely fussy) found plenty she liked. The room was reasonably sized with everything we needed, including LCD television and large bathroom. The only downside was the view which was of the opposite walls, 10 feet away. Location - brilliant - handy for the harbour, beeches, metro and town - the immigration office is quite close but sufficiently far away not to be troubled. To be fair, we were not out late and so I cannot say how safe the area is at night. I woudl definately recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy I Stayed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous booking a room, site unseen – but the price was too good to pass on. To my delight, the hotel was a gem. Located right next to the beautiful waterfront, the hotel is within walking distance to Las Rambles (10 min. walk), and the Gothic Section. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were brand new with flat TV (2 English channels), high ceilings and balcony. The bathroom was as large as my dinning room at home! If you enjoy a peaceful, scenic area – you will love this affordable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's great by the sea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Didn't know anything about this hotel before we go there, but we were very surprised at the quality for the price. There were three of us, and we got a suite with two balconies over looking the plaza. The room was well appointed with all brand new fixtures including large flat screen TV, the bathroom was superb. Breakfast was plenty even for three big lads. Can not think of a fault really, great location by the marina and restaurants and only 150m from the Metro, or Touristic open top bus service in the plaza. Definitely recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean -- all new”
Reviews.Author: DPaxworldwide
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights in mid-January and booked through Hotels, with advice from TripAdvisor reviews. I was a little worried after reading the reviews from 2004, but was pleasantly surprised and quite pleased with the hotel as it appeared to be completely renovated with nice, new interiors. I travel a lot for work and this hotel is very similar to the small boutique business hotels in NYC. I did not have a car and didn't need one because I could walk everywhere in the city and the neighborhood felt (relatively) safe at night. The staff was terrific; they spoke English when I was clearly muddling my Spanish and were helpful. I was on the top floor with a balcony that overlooked the square (see photo of view), which was fantastic. I took these pix for my parents to prove that I was in a decent hotel since they too had read the 2004 reviews here.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great.”
Reviews.Author: lgalvin
Reviews.Content: Location is very convenient.I was leery of this hotel due to the "dump" review here, but it is now far from a dump. It is newly renovated, stylish and clean. The marble stairway is well worn, so I can imagine it has seen from use, but now the restaurant, hallways, rooms and elevators are up to date. The floor of the glass elevators and the bathroom countertops are stones embedded in lucite and the decor is tasteful nautical. Although it is near a busy street, the double paned glass doors to the small balconies shut out the noise. The location is great, very near the marina, Barceloneta beach, aquarium,zoo, park, Picasso musuem, Santa Maria del Mar church, cathedral, Barceloneta metro station and Francia RENFE station. Also nearby is the general Correa post office with Internet and locutorio. At night, the location is a bit of a concern, but I am alert as a female walking alone and it was fine. In the day, the immigration office for extranjos is close and they all seemed angry waiting in line. I didn't have the breakfast because 9 euro seems too much to me, but the dining room looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!! except for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived in barcelona fearing the worst after reading the reviews for this hotel... but since it has been done up, this hotel is now up to a 3 star. Nice small clean rooms, friendly service and ideally located. only problem was the breakfast..dodgy. Price is well decent.... Go for It!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel...being renovated!”
Reviews.Author: Mellymel75
Reviews.Content: We showed up in Barcelona expecting to book our hotel like all of the other places we visited....at a last minute hotel booking office. This did not exist in Barcelona and the information desk at the station did not speak English (I speak french but that didn't do much either) and did not have any information on hotels so we walked around in deperate need of a hotel at about 11 pm! We found a 3 star hotel close to the train station. The gentleman at the front desk spoke English!! He was not Super nice but was nice enough to tell us that a room was available for only 90 EUR. We had just come from Paris, Venice, Florence, Rome and Monaco and this was cheap! We went upstairs having no idea what to expect. It was BY far the nicest hotel we had stayed in and cheaper that our hotel in Rome by 40 EUR! There was no breakfast included but the bed was comfy, the bathroom and shower were LARGE and it had a nice LCD television and a lovely balcony. It seemed that it was at least a 4 star hotel in Vancouver. It is also close to the Gothic Quarter and the double decker bus stop. This hotel made our last few days in Europe enjoyable. What a pleasant surprise..... I am recommending this hotel to my parents for their trip this year.
